question: 迷い
sourceMnemonic: Remember how you learned that <ja>迷う</ja> means "to go astray" or "to get lost?" Well when you feel like you're about to go astray or get lost it causes <vocabulary>hesitation</vocabulary>. You end up with a lot of <vocabulary>doubt</vocabulary> about where to go or what to do. It's a natural progression.
sourceReadingMnemonic: You learned this reading already when you learned <ja>迷う</ja>! Just swap the <ja>う</ja> for an <ja>い</ja>.
